summary: The term "press undertaking" refers to an entity engaged in the production and dissemination of printed or digital news content, operating within the framework of EU communications law. Such undertakings are subject to specific regulatory obligations aimed at ensuring media pluralism, transparency, and the protection of journalistic freedom. The EU recognizes the vital role of press undertakings in fostering democratic discourse and public accountability. Regulatory measures may include compliance with copyright laws, advertising standards, and anti-discrimination provisions. Overall, press undertakings are integral to the EU's commitment to uphold free expression and a diverse media landscape.
